intro: Gynandropsis densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring thick, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces a distinctive capsule fruit. Gynandropsis densiflora is well-suited to dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks.
